title: Theodore Roosevelt National Park: Park Statistics
body: Park Statistics       Acreage Theodore Roosevelt National Park protects more than 70,000 acres over three park units.  South Unit 46,158.57 acres North Unit 24,070.32 acres Elkhorn Ranch Unit 218 acres  Of the 70,446.89 total acres, 29,920 acres are designated Wilderness Area. Designations  Roosevelt Recreation Demonstration Area - 1935 Theodore Roosevelt National Wildlife Refuge - November, 1946 Theodore Roosevelt National Memorial Park - April 25, 1947 Theodore Roosevelt National Park - November 10, 1978  Visitation Theodore Roosevelt National Park receives nearly 600,000 visitors each year. Although the park is open year-round, the busiest months are June, July, and August. Detailed reports on visitation statistics may be found at Annual Visitor Statistic Reports.
